scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection contains four letters to John S. Van E. Kohn regarding first editions of Stuart's work and a letter to George Stevens of the Saturday Review of Literature regarding the copyright status of a poem "Sandy Waters" which Sydney King Russell has set to music, Nelson Eddy has sung and Schirmer is publishing.

did.unittitle: Jesse Stuart to John S. Van E. Kohn 1971 May 3

scopecontent.p: Speaks fondly of the late John Wilson Townsend and his love of books; mentions several of his early books, out of print, which have become collectors' items and are quite expensive; sends Pegasus Magazine.

did.unittitle: Jesse Stuart to John S. Van E. Kohn 1971 May 6

scopecontent.p: Sends a reproduction of Harvest of Youthwhich has become a scare item; says he wrote the poems while in high school, working at steel mills an in Army barracks; explains that it was published in 1930, the year after he finished college.

did.unittitle: Jesse Stuart to John S. Van E. Kohn 1971 May 16

scopecontent.p: Discusses his out of print, sought after, early books; says he will try to find another cop of The Year of My Rebirth

did.unittitle: Jesse Stuart to John S. Van E. Kohn 1971 Jul 26

scopecontent.p: Discusses Harvest of Youthand Tim; tries to trace people who have rare copies of his books; remembers John Wilson Townsend, their first meeting 40 years ago, their long friendship.
